title: Brockton school employee found with gun during ‘inappropriate behavior’ in parking lot, police say
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime The 60-year-old staffer was arraigned Thursday in Brockton District Court.
Police say they found a Brockton school employee engaged in “inappropriate behavior” with a woman in a school parking lot Wednesday evening, and later discovered he was carrying a gun.
Bryce Hatch, 60, pleaded not guilty at his arraignment in Brockton District Court on Thursday to a charge of carrying a dangerous weapon on school grounds, according to court documents.

title: Woman’s body pulled from water in Newbury, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News The body was found north of Fordham Way in Newbury, the Essex County District Attorney said.
The body of an unidentified woman was recovered on Thursday in Newbury, after police responded to a call about a body in the water near Harvard Way, the district attorney said.
The call came in just before noon on Jan.

title: Mass. bakery says it keeps selling out of ‘F— ICE’ cookies, despite death threats
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Food News The cookies have led to threats of assault, rape, and death against the bakery’s employees and their families, but that hasn’t stopped them.
Business is booming like never before at a Western Massachusetts bakery thanks to some politically charged confections.
The Sweet Boutique, a bakery and coffee shop in East Longmeadow, has attracted attention for its expletive-laden cookies protesting U.
